TopicTitle: Can't redownload kerbal space program? Suggestion / Kinda ticked off

Articles.Content:
So i've trying to develop mods for ksp and to try it out i wanted a fresh copy of the .16 version of the game. Since i bought the game in the 0.15 that's all i had in my d/l folder and when i tried to update it, it always said "Unable to connect to server". As an alternative i thought to d/l the 0.16 version directly from the website, but guess what? I couldn't figure out a way to download it without buying it again. Squad either never thought this part through or it's just hidden somewhere and is not easily accessible. If someone could help me out it would be awesome and a few suggestions for the site devs

* GIVE THE OPTION TO THE BUYER TO EASILY DOWNLOAD THE GAME AGAIN IF THEY'VE BOUGHT IT ONCE!

* MAKE THE SDK OPTION MORE READILY VISIBLE !

You guys are great game makers but things like this shouldn't be overlooked by the Community managers and such and should be made user friendly. Thank You.

The only logical thing i had to do is to obtain KSP by means that would be frowned upon by Squad and most of the community because they are such a hard working & dedicated bunch of people. This is more of a customer service complaint at this point.
Did you check your profile in the store?

There is a way to re-download it. Jus login to the store, click on profile under the "Welcome Back" message, and go to the bottom. A little download button next to Kerbal Space Program under the Products Purchased section should be there.

Go to your store account profile, scroll down to the bottom, it will tell you what products you have purchased, there is a download link right next to it.

EDIT: Double ninja'd
I do agree that this is perhaps not the most obvious way to get there. A download link on the main page that asks for you to login would be much more obvious and easier for people to find.

From the FAQ linked on the main page:

HOW DO I GET THE GAME IF I'VE ALREADY PURCHASED IT?

Login to KSP Store. You will find the download link in your Profiles Page or in the Product Detail page.

There's even a step-by-step tutorial with pictures stickied in the Support forum.

Downloading KSP from the Store

You see, it doesn't matter what we do, there will always be someone that just doesn't read or bother to look for answers.

Cheers!
